title.rendered: How to Watch PBR World Finals 2021 Live Stream Online

content.rendered:
This November brings you the 2021 PBR World Finals: Unleash the Beast that will start on Wednesday, November 3, and ends on Sunday, November 7, at the T-Mobile Arena, Las Vegas, Nevada.

Watch NFR 2023 Live Online - SUBSCRIBE HERE

NFR 2023 Streaming info
Streaming
The Cowboy Channel (real-time) Watch Here
RFD-TV (real-time) Watch Here
Cowboy Channel Plus (International) Watch Here

 

If you didn’t have an end-of-year activity, this event should be on your list, especially if you’re a fan of rodeos. Enjoy a memorable experience before saying goodbye to 2021.

In 2021, the PBR World Finals will return to its original home in Las Vegas, where the world’s top riders and bulls will go head-to-head for five days. You can also expect to enjoy features such as pre-event fan zones, rider autograph sessions, after-parties, plus live concerts, and more.

Last year in 2020, this event was held at the AT&T Stadium, Arlington, Texas, following COVID-19 regulations within Nevada state. This was the first time the PBR World Finals were not held in Las Vegas, Nevada, since 1994.

You’ll want to experience a bull riding event unlike any other by watching the world’s top bull riders take on the rankest bulls ever. Experience a nearly life-sized game on two 72 ft by 160 ft high-definition screens as the PBR champion will be announced in 2021. 

Here, we will guide you on everything you need to know to watch PBR World Finals 2021 at the comfort of your home or anywhere in the world. Read on!

2021 PBR World Finals
Venue T-Mobile Arena, Las Vegas, Nevada
Start Date Wednesday, November 3, 2021
End Date Sunday, November 7, 2021
TV Broadcaster CBS Sports Network

When is PBR World Finals 2021?

The 5-day schedule for PBR World Finals 2021 starts on November 3 – November 7 at the T-Mobile Arena. There are a variety of sponsored activities available for PBR fans attending the 2021 World Finals in Las Vegas. You wouldn’t want to miss a once-in-a-lifetime experience such as this.

Where is the PBR World Finals Rodeo 2021 held?

You can watch the best bull riders in the league compete for the big buckle at this PBR Las Vegas World Finals event at the T-Mobile Arena, Las Vegas, Nevada. The event is expected to start at 6:40 PM ET, with the main performances beginning at around 9:40 PM ET.  What are you waiting for? It’s thrilling; it’s fun, and it will leave you on the edge of your seat.

Where is the T-Mobile Arena Rodeo Grounds?

The T-Mobile Arena address is 3780 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89158, USA.

Getting to T-Mobile Arena, an indoor multi-purpose arena in Las Vegas, Nevada, is quite straightforward. Aside from concerts, T-Mobile Arena has also been used for mixed martial arts events, professional boxing matches, and other annual sporting events. Therefore, it’s the home of all sports activities, and you’ll want to be there during the PBR World Finals 2021.

What TV Channel will the PBR World Finals be on?

The CBS Sports Network and RidePass will broadcast the entire PBR World Finals live at 2:00 PM on November 3 – 7. During the five days, the PBR World Finals 2021: Unleash the Beast will not be available on any other TV network apart from the CBS Sports Network. However, this article can help you find everything you need to know about TV and online coverage of the PBR World Finals 2021. fd-uat-autopayroll-app.apps.dfes.wa.gov.au has rounded up everything you need to know about how to watch the PBR World Finals 2021 on TV and online.

Watch PBR World Finals Live Stream Free

CBS Sports Network and RidePass will broadcast the 2021 PBR World Finals on Wednesday through Sunday. 

The CBS Sports Network or CBS Sports will broadcast rides from 10 second-half events. On November 3-7, the CBS Sports Network is scheduled to cover all broadcast and cable television streams consisting of 45+ hours of live-action and highlights of the 2021 PBR season. And you can watch PBR Finals live on your TV anytime and anywhere as long as you have a valid subscription to the CBS Sports Network.

CBS Sports Network Broadcasting Schedule

  • Wed. November 3 – 10:00 PM ET (CBS Sports Network /LIVE)
  • Thur. November 4 – 3:00 AM ET/10:00 PM ET (CBS Sports Network /LIVE)
  • Fri. November 5 – 3:00 AM ET/11:00 PM ET (CBS Sports Network /LIVE)
  • Sat. November 6 – 3:00 AM ET/11:00 PM ET (CBS Sports Network /LIVE)
  • Sun. November 7 – 1:00 PM ET/2:30 PM ET/5:30 PM ET/7:00 PM ET (CBS Sports Network /LIVE)

YETI will present a 30-minute pre-show leading up to the event entitled “B&W Trailer Hitches Inside The Majors.”

PBR RidePass on PlutoTV Broadcasting Schedule

  • Wed. November 3 – 10:00 PM ET (CBS Sports Network /LIVE)
  • Thur. November 4 – 3:00 AM ET/10:00 PM ET (CBS Sports Network /LIVE)
  • Fri. November 5 – 3:00 AM. ET/11:00 PM ET (CBS Sports Network /LIVE)
  • Sat. November 6 – 3:00 AM ET/11:00 PM ET (CBS Sports Network /LIVE)
  • Sun. November 7 – 1:00 PM ET/2:30 PMET/5:30 PM ET/7:00 PM ET (CBS Sports Network /LIVE)

How to watch PBR World Finals live online?

You can catch every action of the PBR World Finals 2021 on the following platforms and devices: 

  • CBS Sports Network
  • Pluto TV
  • Apple TV
  • Fire TV/Fire TV Stick
  • Xbox 
  • Windows 8
  • iOS &Android
  • Chromecast
  • Kindle Fire
  •  Roku. 

To watch from the above devices/platforms, you’ll need to get your TV video service from DirecTV, Comcast, Time Warner Cable, Verizon, Bright House, Cox, At&T, Optimum, U-Verse, Charter, Midcontinent, and Dish

You can also watch the PBR World Finals 2021 on the following platforms:

FuboTV

There is a 7-day trial offer for FuboTV’s streaming service, and it is priced at $19.99/month before going up to $44.99/month later. You can watch Watch ESPN / ESPN3 in dozens of markets through it.

DirecTV Now

At $40/month, this service offers access to over 65 live channels. It is possible to watch most of the CNFR during the free trial period and cancel any time before the trial expires. All you need to do is sign up and receive the free trial to take advantage of the free features. 

Sling TV

Sling TV offers ESPN3, where you can watch PBR World Finals at the comfort of your home or on the go. It would be best to know that this digital streaming service doesn’t cover CBS Sports Network or other local TV stations like NBC, Fox, or ABC.

Hulu TV

At $39.99/month, you can view over 50 live channels. Hulu TV’s free features can only be taken advantage of by registering and receiving the free 7-day trial. At the end of the trial, the service can be canceled for free.

YouTube TV

With this service, you can watch over 50 live channels for just $40 a month. YouTube TV’s free features can only be taken advantage of by registering and receiving the free 7-day trial. At the end of the trial, the service can be canceled for free.

PlayStation Vue

With this plan, you can watch over 75 channels at $49.99 per month. You will need to sign up and receive a free 5-day trial to take advantage of the free options. You can cancel free of charge after the trial period has ended.

PBR RidePass on PlutoTV

With PlutoTV’s PBR RidePass, PBR and western sports fans will find all the content they have come to love about RidePass, for FREE. There will also be original series, news, and more. 

Some of the devices you can enjoy PBR RidePass on Pluto TV include iOS/Android apps, computer browsers, Smart TVs, and other streaming devices (such as Roku, Chromecast, AppleTV, Amazon Fire, etc.).

How to watch PBR live on Radio online?

You can listen to three formats on PBR Radio: PBR Live, PBR Now, and PBR Prime Time, which launches this Saturday. 

Visit this page for a complete listing of stations- www.pbrnow.com/media/radio/schedule.cfm

PBR World Finals 2021 Tickets

Your mind is now set that you’ll be at the T-Mobile Arena come Nov 3-Nov 7. But you will need to obtain tickets to the arena to watch PBR World Finals 2021.

Let’s get you started on several travel packages at your disposal based on two people only with different prices. They include:

  • $2,500 for Travel Package 1
  • $1,850 for Travel Package 2
  • $1,500 for Travel Package 3
  • $1,400 for Travel Package 4

Additionally, you can also enjoy two limited event tickets. They include

  •  $50/pp Bull Housing (Available Thursday – Sunday of finals)
  • $50/pp Behind the Scenes Tour (Available Thursday – Sunday of finals)

Click https://pbr.com/tickets/ to find more information about PBR tickets.

You don’t want to go overboard with ticket prices, and that’s why it’s recommended you always go for the ticket packages that fit your budget and preferences.

Final Words

For every rodeo fan out there, they need to watch the PBR World Finals: Unleash the Beast before 2021 winds up. It’s more than just a rodeo event that will take place on Nov 3-Nov 7 at the T-Mobile Arena, Las Vegas, Nevada. You’ll get to experience PBR Finals Week and the surrounding festivities that come with this landmark of an event.  You have no excuses whatsoever as to why you won’t watch PBR live action either from the comfort of your home or on the go.

We’re not yet finished with you! Let’s give you a head start by providing more additional venue information through the following links.

  • Seating information- https://www.t-mobilearena.com/events-tickets
  • Parking Information- https://www.t-mobilearena.com/plan-your-visit/parking
  • Prohibited Items- https://www.t-mobilearena.com/guest-services/prohibited-items
